title: The City Mouse and the Country Mouse

moral.text: It is better to live in self-sufficient poverty than to be tormented by the worries of wealth.
People who speak disparagingly of things that they cannot attain would do well to apply this instructive little story to their own lives.
If you think a scoundrel will reward you for a job well done, you are making two mistakes: first, you are helping someone who doesn’t deserve it, and second, you will be lucky to escape unharmed.

title: The Lion and the Mouse on His Mane

moral.text: This fable's moral is implicit in the narrative and concerns [brief description of the implied message].

title: The Fox and the Goat in the Well

moral.text: As soon as someone clever gets into trouble, he tries to find a way out at someone else’s expense.
